a:r.a:t:
edits: "Plane-Based"; "of wall or floor space" I see three pieces of information under your heading: 1. size and type requirement, 2. comparison to something they already have/know, 3. specialized preparation
If these three pieces of information are equal in importance, can we make them all bullets and then keep that same format on each slide? That way my brain knows what #1., 2., and 3. will tell me as we progress through the next 4 slides. This is abstract stuff, so I think keeping the formatting as clear as possible will help get the information across. I love these graphics as well.
